cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving N-NW tonight, then turning north and NNE on Monday–Tuesday while tracking up the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic, and New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ocracoke Inlet NC northward to Watch Hill RI, including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds, Chesapeake Bay, Tidal Potomac River, Delaware Bay, Long Island & Long Island Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC under Tropical Storm Warning; no warnings north of that yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Atlantic coast from Florida through the Mid-Atlantic and New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 kt, gusts 45–55 kt) possible Tuesday; 24% chance of ≥34-kt and 4% chance of ≥50-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation above ground possible along the upper Chesapeake Bay and tidal Potomac River
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated amounts up to 8 inches, producing flash and urban flooding potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk and dangerous surf/rip currents ahead of and during passage
